channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2023110449
item.description:
Report E-2023110449

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 13, 2023, four (4) 55-pound bags of UN3378 were damaged and released approximately ten (10) pounds of product to the pallet and trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. A HEPA-filtered drum vacuum was used to collect all freestanding product. The undamaged cargo was re-palletized for continued processing and shipping. The damaged bags were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The contents of the vacuum and all UN3378-impacted materials were collected and containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023110444
item.description:
Report E-2023110444

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 10, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1139 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the release and swept them in utilizing hand tools. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110341
item.description:
Report E-2023110341

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-17
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, a pallet of (UN3265) NALCO DC14 shifted resulting in the caps of (3) Jerricans hitting the pallet/trailer floor and releasing approximately 5-gallons of product. A contractor neutralized the spilled product with Sodium Bicarbonate prior to cleaning up the release. Once the lids were tightened on the (3) Jerricans, they were able to ship on to the intended destination. No storm drains. waterways, or soil were impacted.

item.title: Report E-2023110244
item.description:
Report E-2023110244

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 2, 2023, two (2) one-gallon cans of UN1263 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews downstacked and repalletized the non-impacted pails of product onto a new pallet. The damaged pails and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND WET. UPON INSPECTION, ONE CAN HAD LEAKED FORM LOOSE CAP. ITEM IS LIMITED QUANTITY FLAMMABLE LIQUID WITH NO DIAMONDS ON PLASTIC BAG PACKAGING (PACKAGE IS RETURN FROM INDIVIDUAL.) DescribePack: ONE CAN LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED.

item.title: Report X-2023101425
item.description:
Report X-2023101425

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on its side in trailer, leaking when door was opened. QA called to inspect and cleanup before anyone stepped into trailer. Upon inspection, package was placed upright in a lined tote and sent to QA for processing. It was then placed in a yellow salvage drum ASAP. DescribePack: One bottle had a loose cap causing half of the liquid inside to leak into trailer. Box was tipped over on side when found. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed upright in a lined tote with the cap placed back on. Was then sent to QA for further processing where it was placed in a yellow salvage drum.

item.title: Report E-2023110214
item.description:
Report E-2023110214

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 30, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was crushed in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and utilized hand tools to collect the product in two (2) 55-gallon drums. The one (1) damaged pail was overpacked in one (1) of the previously mentioned waste drums.

item.title: Report X-2023101390
item.description:
Report X-2023101390

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The flammable liquid package was located and investigated. The package was processed at the origin station but was refused here at the customer. Package located in front of the haz cage stained from inside. Further inspection confirmed that one of the bottles was leaking the flammable liquid product inside carton. DescribePack: Defective bottle releasing liquid contents from the seam on the bottle that may not have been properly sealed during production of plastic bottle. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a tote and placed in the haz cage to try to not move as much to keep liquid at a standstill.

item.title: Report X-2023101350
item.description:
Report X-2023101350

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found upside down and wet next to bank 3 of the RORS unload. Package had Fully Regulated Corrosive labeling. Package was immediately picked up and taken off the warehouse floor, along with the affected area being cleaned up. DescribePack: 3 of the 4 plastic bottles inside had their tops crushed inward. This led to the caps of those bottles becoming bent and loose, which led to a leak. The package's box was also soiled. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat Cage for isolation and processing.

item.title: Report X-2023101344
item.description:
Report X-2023101344

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The flammable liquid package located in a tote in front of the haz cage. Further inspection confirmed that at two of the glass bottles inside were damaged and shattered due to package being dropped. The package was previously processed and became damaged on the OTP DescribePack: One of the 4 Liter bottles was completely shattered inside and the other one was missing a cap in which the inside flammable liquid was exposed and leaking DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Placed under hood until it dried

item.title: Report X-2023101157
item.description:
Report X-2023101157

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023101157-EMPLOYEE CALLED WITH A CORROSIVE HAZMAT LEAKER IN BAY 42. RESPONDER RESPONDED WITH FULL PPE AND STOCKED SPILL CART. FOLLOWED DT, CLEANED UP SPILL AND BROUGHT ALL BACK TO DMP FOR PROCESSING. X-2023101158 -HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS FOUND BY RESPONDER ON A BULK CART AT THE PURGE AREA NEAR BAY 470. THERE WAS SLIGHT WET CORNERS/SIDE OF BOX. UPON RETURN TO DMP AREA INVESTIGATION BY RESPONDER SHOWED THERE WAS A LEAK AT CLOSURE RESULTING IN ABRADED/SOILING LABELING AND PACKAGING.
